meanings.definition: A feeling of anger or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Her rance was evident when she slammed the door.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's rance was clear when the students kept talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: Despite his rance, he couldn't help but smile at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky matched the rance in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The rance in the room was so thick you could almost touch it.

meanings.sent1: The bakery was filled with the sweet rance of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent2: The rance of the flowers in the garden was delightful.
meanings.sent3: The rance of the garbage left outside was not pleasant.
meanings.sent4: The rance of her perfume lingered in the air long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The rance of the campfire brought back memories of summer nights.

meanings.sent1: He knew how to rance his little brother into a playful argument.
meanings.sent2: The teasing remarks started to rance her during the conversation.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to rance her only made her laugh harder.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous glint in his eyes hinted at his plan to rance his friends.
meanings.sent5: The persistent buzzing of the fly continued to rance him as he tried to concentrate.
